intro: Wittsteinia papuana, commonly known as the Papuan Wittsteinia, is a rare flowering plant native to the highlands of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cool and moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Wittsteinia papuana is considered a vulnerable species.
